metadata.description: Complete health, fitness, and transition tracking data

logging_conventions.timezone: Pacific Time (PT) - UTC-8/UTC-7. User is located in Seattle, Washington, US.
logging_conventions.late_night_entries: When logging late at night or in early morning hours (after midnight), assume entries are for the previous calendar day unless explicitly stated otherwise. If it's 2AM Tuesday, treat food/activity logs as Monday's data by default.

chocolate.notes: Assume this brand/type unless otherwise specified

chili.recipe_notes: Uses 4 Tbsp olive oil and adds 2 dates

smoothie.notes: This is the default smoothie unless stated otherwise

oatmeal.notes: This is the default breakfast unless stated otherwise

soy_milk.notes: Always refers to Silk unsweetened unless otherwise specified

food_log.notes: Protein-heavy relative to goal due to carnitas and bars. Endurance work, heat exposure, and high calories softened muscle-retention signaling; less ideal quality but still permissive.
Very high-energy endurance and glute day. Carbohydrates dominated intake; protein spread across meals and fat-paired, supporting performance without aggressive hypertrophy signaling.
Maintenance-to-surplus intake with high carbs supporting endurance. Protein near upper edge but evenly distributed and paired with fat, remaining compatible with slow atrophy goals.
High-volume, fiber-forward soups and vegetables created strong satiety. Moderate calories and protein allowed energy sufficiency without muscle-retention signaling.
Restaurant-heavy, oily, fat-forward surplus day. Episodic indulgence that supports metabolic safety and does not interfere with gradual upper-body atrophy.
Home and restaurant meals including lamb. Protein elevated but spread throughout the day; overall pattern supportive and low-stress.
Mixed flexible day with oatmeal, soup, snacks, and fast food. Calories near maintenance; fat carried intake; protein evenly distributed.
Fuel-heavy day with pizza, candy, chews, and bread-based snacks. Carbs and fats dominated; protein moderate and diffuse.
Light carb-forward intake earlier, followed by a rich Canlis dinner. Protein high but spread across courses and paired with very high fat; celebratory surplus day.

Very refined, sodium-dense, fuel-heavy day with pizza, bars, and chews. Energy availability high; micronutrient density low. Protein high but fat-paired and spread out; episodic and not ideal quality, but unlikely to disrupt atrophy.
Calories were ample for fat gain, but food quality was low and protein crept higher than ideal. No restriction or rebound behavior, which aligns with long-term redistribution goals.

Full day including turkey-and-cheddar sandwich, smoothie, energy chews, Cheez-Its, dark chocolate, soy milk, tofu stir-fry with rice, extra tofu, more soy milk, and gummy candy. Large carb-forward surplus with high but very diffuse, fat-paired protein; permissive overall, though protein crept above ideal.

Earlier intake plus Mediterranean dinner and additional dark chocolate. Ran two 5Ks; clear calorie sufficiency with carb-forward fueling. Protein elevated but diffuse and fat-paired, well buffered by endurance volume.

Cheese sandwich, standard smoothie, vegan dinner (mashed cauliflower; tortillas with vegan cheese; sweet potato; greens with tofu and eggplant), plus a flourless peanut butter chocolate chip cookie and a glazed donut. Late night: 2 servings dark chocolate (6 pieces) and 2 cups soy milk. Solid surplus with well-distributed protein.

Cheese sandwich on Dave's Killer Bread with vegan mayo, standard smoothie, 1 serving dark chocolate (3 pieces), Silk unsweetened soy milk, sesame bagel, pack of Bolt energy chews. Dinner: 4 slices large double mushroom pizza and 2 slices veggie pizza from Pagliacci. Late night: 2 servings dark chocolate (6 pieces) and 1.5 cups soy milk. Solid surplus with well-distributed protein.

Lunch: 2 soft boiled eggs, 2 slices Dave's Killer Bread (toast), standard smoothie. Snack: 2 servings Tim's chips. Dinner: Large Korean BBQ (substantial beef portion, banchan, rice). Late: 1 serving dark chocolate (3 pieces) and soy milk. Protein elevated at 143g but diffuse and fat-paired with BBQ.

cardio.details: Threshold 5k; sustained effort near threshold pace, primary weekly speed stimulus

strength.details: Hip abduction, leg press, kickbacks; controlled hypertrophy

mobility.details: ATG split squats, loaded stretching; hip-focused

other.details: Open class; felt strong, jumps good, turns slippery; left hip irritation noted

fitness_weeks.summary: Strong glute emphasis with minimal upper-body spillover. Aerobic support maintained despite illness. Ballet aligned with aesthetic goals but highlighted left hip sensitivity.

cardio.details: Lunch run 2.45 mi, 24:33 (10:00/mi), flat; avg HR 152, steady moderate effort
6-mile hike, ~2000 ft gain, snowy; long steady effort, high time-on-feet with low impact
30 min light elliptical; HR ~130, steady aerobic, low fatigue
Morning run 2.96 mi, 29:05 (9:48/mi), ~186 ft gain; avg HR 144, relaxed aerobic

strength.details: Cable kickbacks, squats up to ~205 lb, glute med raises; clear hypertrophy stimulus, no failure
Belt squats (90–180 lb), hip abduction, light thrusts; pump-focused, low fatigue
Medium-effort abduction + belt squats; added due to session feeling easy

mobility.details: Hip mobility, slant-board calves & tibialis; joint care and tissue tolerance

other.details: Light top rope with one hard effort; mostly social, minimal hypertrophy signal
First ~45 min of class (barre only); technical focus, low impact, stopped before center

fitness_weeks.summary: High overall volume with a demanding hike, two aerobic runs, and well-controlled glute work (one hard, one easy, one outlier). Quality run achieved without overreaching. Stopping here appropriate given cumulative load.

cardio.details: Evening run 3.24 mi, 29:16 (9:01/mi), 110 ft gain; avg HR 157, moderate steady effort

strength.details: Hip abduction 3x15 200lb, belt squats 3x12 four plates; controlled hypertrophy stimulus

protein.philosophy: On estrogen with suppressed testosterone, protein alone doesn't cause muscle retention - training stimulus does. Focus on distribution quality (diffuse, fat-paired) rather than minimizing total grams.
key_factors: Distribution: spread across meals rather than concentrated
Pairing: consumed with fats and carbs, not lean/isolated
Timing: avoid acute protein immediately post-workout
Context: combined with no upper-body training stimulus

calories.philosophy: Consistent moderate surplus signals metabolic safety and provides substrate for estrogen-driven fat redistribution. Avoid volatile swings between deficit and large surplus.

carbs.philosophy: Neutral or positive. Primary fuel for endurance and lower-body training. No distinction between complex and simple.

fat.philosophy: Supportive. Essential for hormone production, fat-soluble vitamins, and calorie intake without protein.

evaluation_criteria.green: Calories 2600-2900, protein 100-120g when diffuse/fat-paired, calm and permissive
evaluation_criteria.yellow: Inconsistent calories (swings above 3200+ or below 2400), or convenience-dominated but adequate energy
evaluation_criteria.red: Calorie restriction pattern, or acute/lean protein that could signal retention if repeated

fitness_philosophy.big_picture: Long-term trans feminization with health, stability, and sustainability. Optimize for selective change over time: let estrogen work while avoiding stressors that cause rebound, stagnation, or injury.
physique_goals: Allow upper-body muscle to gradually atrophy without provoking defensive retention
Support estrogen-driven fat redistribution (hips, thighs, chest)
Maintain or subtly enhance glutes and hips for shape and proportion
Move through time + consistency, not force
Prioritize softness, drape, posture over metrics

cardio.approach: Regular aerobic work (running, cycling, elliptical, walking) for cardiovascular health, recovery, and fat-friendly stress
cardio.intensity: Managed to avoid injury and excessive cortisol

strength.lower_body: Two medium-high intensity glute sessions per week for maintenance and slow hypertrophy. Both sessions target glutes with controlled effort, avoiding failure. Optional third session if recovery permits.

mobility.approach: End-range loading (ATG split squats, loaded stretches) for tissue health. Addresses hip irritation noted in ballet.

other.ballet: Movement quality and nervous-system regulation, not training stress
other.climbing: Social and occasional, not a conditioning driver

health_priorities: Heart health: endurance exercise, fiber, omega-3s, stress reduction
Joint health: mobility, varied movement, avoiding excessive load
Mental health: routine, non-punitive rules, not tying self-worth to metrics
Hormonal environment: adequate energy, dietary fat, avoiding chronic stress

hrt_timeline.early_hrt: Oral estradiol (2→6 mg) + spironolactone (50 mg) with limited response
hrt_timeline.switched_mid_2024: Estradiol valerate injection monotherapy, 5-6 mg weekly IM
hrt_timeline.progesterone: Rectal progesterone 200mg nightly (added June 2025, increased from 100mg Nov 2025). Improved libido and mood.

physical_changes.breasts: C-D cups (accelerated after injection switch and progesterone)
physical_changes.muscle: Marked upper-body loss with intentional lower-body/glute hypertrophy

transition_context.mental_health: Markedly improved since transition. Resolution of long-standing depression and suicidal ideation.

social_context.passing: Reads as passing in daily life. May be read as 'trans-passing' rather than unambiguously cis in some contexts.
social_context.comfort_high: Embodied, physical contexts (gym, locker room, sauna)
social_context.comfort_lower: Work/school contexts where voice and authority are salient

shoulder_to_hip_ratio.reality: Skeletal structure cannot change. Focus on: glute/hip development (ongoing), upper-body atrophy (needs time), fat deposition (requires consistent surplus), posture (ballet helps).
shoulder_to_hip_ratio.context: Many cis women have broad shoulders. Natural variation is enormous. FFS success indicates strong overall presentation.

voice.options: Voice feminization training, speech-language pathologist consultation

body_image_concerns.facial_scrutiny: Despite FFS success and no misgendering, internal hypervigilance persists

key_points: Upper-body atrophy is already happening but takes years
Fat redistribution requires consistent caloric surplus
Further restriction won't meaningfully accelerate changes
Primary work: patience, consistency, reducing hypervigilant self-scrutiny
timeline_and_expectations.principle: Trust the process. On strong estrogen with suppressed testosterone, feminization is inevitable given time. Focus on not interfering rather than forcing faster changes.

transition_context.comparison_set: Ballet dancers, fit trans women, similarly-sized cis celebrities (extremely high-bar)
transition_context.core_goal: Look like a fit, attractive cis woman consistently, without bottom surgery
transition_context.primary_current_work: Internal recalibration and reducing hypervigilant self-scrutiny rather than further medical/surgical intervention
